conclusion: To determine the relationship between the accelerations of Car A and Car B, we need to analyze the velocity-time (vt) graph provided.
The y-axis represents velocity (v). The x-axis represents time (t). Car A's velocity increases from v1 to v2 over time t1. Car B's velocity decreases from v2 to v1 over the same time t1.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time, represented by the slope of the velocity-time graph.

premise: For Car A, the slope of the graph is positive and decreasing.
conclusion: The acceleration is positive but decreasing over time for Car A.

premise: For Car B, the slope of the graph is negative and increasing in magnitude.
conclusion: The acceleration is negative but increasing in magnitude over time for Car B.
The magnitude of acceleration is the absolute value of the slope of the velocity-time graph.

premise: For Car A, the slope becomes less steep.
conclusion: The magnitude of acceleration decreases for Car A.

premise: For Car B, the slope becomes steeper.
conclusion: The magnitude of acceleration increases for Car B.

premise: During the time interval from t=0 to t=t1, the magnitude of the acceleration of Car A gradually decreases. During the same time interval, the magnitude of the acceleration of Car B gradually increases.
